page.title: 01General View of Clun Area
page.content: The block has the village of Clun at its centre and apart from this settlement it is a purely agricultural area. The area inside the block has a population of about 1000. It is an ancient settlement dating back to Saxon times and the signs of its long history are all around. The street layout is a Norman grid plan. The surrounding area is outstandingly beautiful, consisting of undulating hills, made up of patchwork fields and mixed woodland. The area is dominated by agriculture. Farms vary in size from under 100 to over 1000 acres and are all of the mixed type combining livestock(mainly cattle & sheep) and arable(cereals). The reletively isolated position of the area has enabled it to maintain its traditional character without a disproportionate number of commuters or holiday homes.
